Kayako - ticket id 60241392 // Ciprian Nastase commented privately:  Hello Ciprian,
we are having problems with the traffic rules on the new firewalls. We have defined a special rule because our pharmacies need to access the Austrian health network via a route. You have to imagine that in the pharmacy there are card readers that communicate directly with the health network, because the customers’ prescriptions are retrieved via a chip card (E-Card).

These card readers are located in the pharmacy’s local network and must access the health network through a route to their dedicated router. The response from this router may only return via NAT to a specific address (the address of the Kerio firewall). We solved this using a route and a dedicated traffic rule.

On the NG120, when we disable the traffic rule, routing works, but the card readers – logically – receive no response. When we enable the traffic rule, the routing itself stops working. 

Attached are two images for illustration. 

image 
image 
image

As the device is now functioning correctly, we will close this initial ticket related to the boot/UUID issue. However, should the boot issue reoccur, please feel free to respond here and we will reopen the ticket promptly.

Best regards,
Central Support Team
